授業の概要・背景: This course is designed to prepare students for overseas experience prior to departure and ensure that they maximize this opportunity. At the end of this course the students will have an extensive knowledge of the country they will be living in and the program and institution they will belong to. This course also helps students better understand about some aspects of Japanese culture, various cultural stereotypes, and current Japan issues. The class is conducted entirely in English and students are expected to speak only in English for the entire 100 minutes each class. Much of the class time is used for student centered discussions about their target countries. Additionally, a portion of class time each lesson will be designated for phatic daily conversation to help students practice casual self-facilitated English conversation and build oral fluency confidence.
授業方法: All classes are conducted on campus, face-to-face style. Google Classroom will be used for some course information and assignment submissions, and, also for any outside of class contact with the teacher. This course is centered mainly on discussions based on the textbook information and individual autonomously researched information about a personally chosen study abroad destination. This is NOT a lecture style course, it requires interactive English only discussions with classmates every lesson.

トピック.授業計画1: This class is conducted entirely in English and students will be expected to ONLY speak English during class. Students will be expected to actively participate in lengthy interactive discussions with their classmates each week.
トピック.授業外学習2: This course is designed to prepare students who intend to study abroad, as such it is expected that the students will do a large amount of work outside of the classroom. This preparation will include; updating your Study Abroad Journal, preparing questions for discussions with KGU foreign students, pre-reading and completing text book activities in preparation for discussions in the next lesson, and finally planning, preparation and practice for both presentations.
